title: Linux setconsole Command with Practical Examples
description: This lab explores the setconsole command in Linux, which allows you to modify the system console device and redirect console output to a file. Learn how to effectively manage your Linux system's console settings.

meta.title: Linux setconsole Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: This lab explores the setconsole command in Linux, which allows you to modify the system console device and redirect console output to a file. Learn how to effectively manage your Linux system's console settings.
meta.keywords: Linux, setconsole, console, system configuration, system settings, file redirection

steps.title: Understand the Purpose of setconsole Command

verify.name: Verify the current system console device
verify.hint: Ensure that the current system console device is /dev/tty1.

verify.name: Verify the system console device has been changed
verify.hint: Ensure that the system console device has been changed to /dev/tty2.

steps.title: Redirect Console Output to a File

verify.name: Verify the console output has been redirected to a file
verify.hint: Ensure that the console output has been redirected to the /tmp/console.log file.
